title.rendered: Hamas and Islamic Jihad Terrorists Found Operating Inside UNRWA’s Headquarters in Central Gaza

content.rendered:
IDF troops conducted a critical counterterrorism operation in Gaza City, targeting and eliminating Hamas and Islamic Jihad terrorists who were operating from within UNRWA’s central headquarters. This site, ostensibly designated for humanitarian purposes, was exploited by these groups as an operational base for conducting attacks against IDF troops in central Gaza. This operation is yet another clear example of UNRWA facilities being co-opted—or willingly used—as safe havens for terrorist activities, raising significant concerns about the organization’s actual role and the extent of its complicity.

UNRWA’s Facilities: A Base for Terrorism

The presence of terrorists operating out of UNRWA’s headquarters signals more than an isolated incident; it is a demonstration of the organization’s ongoing failure to maintain neutrality and safeguard its facilities from terrorist exploitation. The IDF’s discovery of large amounts of weaponry within this UNRWA site, combined with the direct confrontation in close-quarters combat, illustrates how deeply entrenched these terrorist elements have become in structures that should serve as beacons of humanitarian aid.

Ensuring Civilian Safety

Before commencing the operation, IDF troops established a defined corridor to facilitate the safe evacuation of civilians from the vicinity, showcasing Israel’s commitment to protecting non-combatants even amid counterterrorism operations. The operation led to the neutralization of the terrorists and the securing of the area to prevent further misuse of UNRWA’s headquarters for military purposes.

Ongoing Military Efforts

In addition to the operation in central Gaza, IDF forces have made significant strides in dismantling terrorist infrastructure throughout the region. In Shejaiya, troops eliminated dozens of terrorists and took out underground tunnel networks used for covert movements and attacks. A combined aerial and ground strike targeted and neutralized ten terrorists spotted monitoring IDF activity from a structure in the area.

Operations in southern Gaza, specifically in Rafah, continue as IDF troops locate and dismantle weapons caches and infrastructure, targeting those complicit in constructing and managing terror operations. IAF strikes over the past day have successfully targeted key figures in Hamas, including operatives involved in tunnel networks and anti-tank missile units.

The discovery and elimination of terrorists within UNRWA’s headquarters are yet another indicator of the blurred line between humanitarian aid facilities and terrorist strongholds. UNRWA’s repeated implication in such incidents challenges its credibility and underscores the urgent need for stringent oversight and accountability. It is imperative for the international community to recognize the ongoing exploitation of these facilities and ensure that aid structures do not continue to serve as shields for terrorism, jeopardizing both civilian lives and regional stability.
